</div>

<div id="cmsmasters_row_673c2e7129d021_30275005" class="cmsmasters_row cmsmasters_color_scheme_default tourflexBox cmsmasters_row_top_default cmsmasters_row_bot_default cmsmasters_row_boxed">

<div class="cmsmasters_column two_third">
<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/himachal-pradesh-with-delhi.jpg" alt="Himachal Pradesh with Delhi Darshan" title="Himachal Pradesh with Delhi Darshan" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>Himachal Pradesh is famous for its Himalayan scenery and popular hill stations. Many outdoor activities, such as rock climbing, mountain biking, paragliding, ice skating, trekking, rafting, and heli-skiing, are popular tourist attractions in this region. Although once it was known as the summer destination, yet with time and enhancing tourism facilities now one can visit all year round. This 9 days / 8 nights would be a truly worthwhile vacation for you.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Himachal with Delhi Darshan Tour Itinerary</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Delhi – Manali</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>Welcome to Delhi, catch your Volvo from Delhi at 5.30 PM. Overnight-journey.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Manali Arrive Local</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>You are greeted on arrival at Manali Volvo stand by Namaste India Trip representative and drive to the hotel, check-into hotel (12.00 Noon early check-in depend on availability). After fresh- up go for half day local sightseeing Morning proceed for a half day tour of Manali visiting Hadimba Devi Temple – built in the tranquil and serene woods, Vashisht Bath, Tibetan Monastery, and Roerich art Gallery. Later visit Manikaran has the World’s hottest Sulfur Spring Waters and is a holy place for Hindus & Sikhs alike. Back to the hotel, have dinner. Overnight stay at Manali.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Manali Sightseeing – Rohtang Pass</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today morning, proceed on a day excursion to the Rohtang pass. If roads to Rohtang pass are closed, then visit snow point where ponies/horses can be hired directly, later visit Solang Valley where Himachal’s best ski slopes can be found( here you can enjoy paragliding, horse-riding, scooter riding etc. on direct payment basis). The rest of the day is free to explore this scenic town, Overnight stay at Hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Manali Local & Manikaran – Kasol Valley – Kullu</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Morning After breakfast visit Famous Kullu- Manikaran- Kasol Valley, evening free. Night stay in Manali.</p>
<p>The Kullu- is spread in the entire Kullu valley which is lavishly gifted with superb scenic wealth. Kullu also was known as ‘Valley of Gods’ has numerous temples. Kullu valley offers a scenic charm of peaceful wooded glades and rivers through the rocks. The Dussehra of Kullu is world famous. The ancient Hindus regarded Kullu as the farthest limit of human habitation ‘Kulanta Pitha’ and its original name finds mention in the epics, The Ramayana and Mahabharat as well as the Vishnu Purana. Kullu, which is located on the bank of river Beas is the Central point of this tourist complex. Running North to South, the main river valley is only 80 km. long and 2 km. at its broadest, yet a fairly wide area is open to the visitors to enjoy the spectacle of variegated mountain scenery. The deodar-fringed grassy Maidan, Dhalpur, is a stage for many colorful fairs.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Manali – Shimla</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Morning After breakfast transfer you to catch your deluxe bus from Manali to Shimla, capital of Britishers also set amidst, the snow copper, Shivalik, mountains which offer some of the most beautiful views of Himalaya where on arrival, you will check into your hotel. The rest of the evening is at leisure. Night stay in Shimla.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>In Shimla</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Morning proceeds for the sightseeing Shimla covering Kalbadevi Temple, Jakhu Temple, Hanuman Temple or stop for a while at the beautiful stained-glass-windows of Christ Church, which was built in the 1850s. Afternoon excursion to Kufri a 30 Minutes’ drive from Shimla, an exotica of nature as a place surrounded by dense forest and snow capped mountains amidst virgin peaks and natures flora and fauna where one can completely relax and tune oneself for natural beauty, Evening free to enjoy the scenic beauty of Kufri. Fagu, Indira Gandhi Holiday Home and enjoy horse riding in the apple orchids. Return to the Hotel Rest of the day is free to explore various scenic sights or visit mall road and shopping. Night stay at Hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 7 :</span>Shimla – Delhi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Morning Proceed to Shimla Volvo stand at morning at 8.15 AM. Drive to Delhi, evening on arrival at Delhi, we will pick you and transfer to the hotel. Overnight stay at Delhi.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 8 :</span>Delhi City Tour</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today we are fully packed for Delhi Local city tour including lotus temple, Akshardham temple, Chandni Chowk market, Qutub Minar etc. overnight stay at Delhi.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 9 :</span>Delhi Departure</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After breakfast, we will drop you at airport/ railway station for your onward journey.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Himachal Pradesh with Delhi Darshan</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is Unique About Tourism In Himachal Pradesh?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Many outdoor activities are popular tourist attractions in Himachal Pradesh, including rock climbing, mountain biking, paragliding, ice skating, trekking, rafting, and heli-skiing.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Place In Himachal Gets The Maximum Number Of Tourists?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Himachal’s most popular tourist destinations are Shimla, Manali, and Dharamshala.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is The Main Speciality Of Himachal Pradesh?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Himachal Pradesh is famous for its handicrafts. Carpets, leather works, shawls, paintings, metalware, and woodwork are all noteworthy. The pashmina shawl is a popular item not only in Himachal but also throughout the country. Himachali caps are also well-known works of art by their people.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Is The Largest River In Himachal Pradesh?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The Chenab River is the largest and is formed by the confluence of two streams, Chandra and Bhaga, in Tandi, Lahaul.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is The Traditional Dress Of Himachal Pradesh Known As?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> ‘Sultan’ (on the lower part of the body) and ‘Chola’ (on the upper part) with a ‘Dora’ belt. Women cover their heads with long shawls called ‘Pattoo’ and Dhatu’ or ‘Thipu’. Himachal Pradesh’s tribal clothing is mostly hand woven and thus very popular.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

excerpt.rendered: Himachal Pradesh with Delhi Darshan Home » India » Himachal Pradesh » Himachal Pradesh with Delhi Darshan Tour Overview Himachal Pradesh is famous for its Himalayan scenery and popular hill stations. Many outdoor activities, such as rock climbing, mountain biking, paragliding, ice skating, trekking, rafting, and heli-skiing, are popular tourist attractions in this region. Although...
